Power to give permission for trial of case by foreign court : (1) If both parties to a case which involves a foreign party and is sub judice in a court of Nepal make a joint petition to the court, specifying the reason that it is appropriate and practicable for that case to be resolved by a court of the country of residence of such party and the matter is found reasonable upon 214 examination of the petition, the court may give permission for the proceedings of the case by the foreign court as demanded by the parties to such a case.
output: According to Section 716(1): Rule: The joint petition must specify reasons why it is appropriate and practicable for the foreign court (of the foreign party's residence) to resolve the case; the Nepali court will examine the petition and may grant permission if it finds the reasons reasonable. Application/Conclusion: In your petition you must explain and justify why the foreign court is the proper and practical forum; if the Nepali court deems those reasons reasonable, it can allow the foreign proceedings.

instruction: If a Nepali court believes a foreign judgment will directly affect our local case, what remedy is available?
input: Section no 717 . Power to adjourn case sub judice in court of Nepal : If any case between the parties is sub judice in a court of Nepal and a case is running also in a foreign court between such parties in the same matter, and the parties, having considered that the case pending in the court of Nepal is likely to be directly affected by a judgment to be made in the case between them running in the foreign court, apply for the adjournment of the case running in Nepal, the court may adjourn such a case until their case pending in the foreign court is adjudged.
output: According to Section 717: Rule: The Nepali court may adjourn its proceedings where the same parties have a parallel foreign proceeding likely to directly affect the Nepal case, upon the parties' application. Application/Conclusion: You can apply for an adjournment; if the court agrees the foreign judgment will directly affect the Nepal proceedings, it can suspend the Nepal case until the foreign court decides.

instruction: Under which section does the Act authorise the court to permit trial by a foreign court?
input: Section no 716 . Application/Conclusion: If the parties jointly petition under the conditions in Section 716 and the court finds the petition reasonable, the Nepali court may allow the foreign court to proceed with the case.

instruction: I signed a contract but the agreement didn't say which country's law applies. It will be performed abroad. Which law governs?
input: part (2) : If no law is determined pursuant to sub-section (1), such a contract shall be governed by the law of the country of its performance, and if even such a country cannot be ascertained, by the law of the country where it was concluded. Provided that a contract concluded in Nepal shall be governed by the law of Nepal.
output: According to Section 709(2)... Rule: If no choice of law is made under sub-section (1), the contract is governed by the law of the country where it is performed; if that country cannot be ascertained, by the law of the country where it was concluded, with the proviso that a contract concluded in Nepal is governed by Nepal law. Application/Conclusion: Because your contract did not specify a governing law and performance is abroad, the law of the country of performance will govern the contract. If you cannot determine the country of performance, then the law of the country where you concluded the contract will govern; however if the contract was concluded in Nepal, Nepalese law applies.

instruction: Will Nepal accept a deed made in another country if it followed that country's procedures?
input: Section no 710 . Deed executed abroad to be recognized : The validity of any contract or deed executed outside Nepal shall be determined according to the law of the country where it has been executed, and such a contract or deed shall be deemed lawful and recognized in Nepal if it has been duly executed in accordance with the law of that country.
output: According to Section 710... Rule: Validity of contracts/deeds executed outside Nepal is determined by the law of the country where executed; if duly executed under that law, they are deemed lawful and recognized in Nepal. Application/Conclusion: If the deed was validly executed under the foreign country's law, Nepal will recognize it as lawful; you should verify it complied with that country's formalities.

instruction: A Nepali citizen (donor) executed a donation while abroad. Which country's law decides if that donation is valid?
input: Section no 711 . To be governed by law of nationality of donor : (1) The matter concerning validity of a donation or gift shall be governed by the 404 law of the country of donor’s nationality existing when the donation or gift was made.
output: According to Section 711(1)... Rule: The validity of a donation or gift is governed by the law of the donor's country of nationality at the time the donation was made. Application/Conclusion: Because the donor is a Nepali national, the validity of the donation is determined by Nepalese law (the donor's nationality law at the time of donation).

instruction: If someone gives me a gift while we are in another country and they followed that country's formality, is the gift valid?
input: Section no 711  part (2) : If the formalities are completed according to the law of the country where a donation or gift is given, the donation or gift shall be deemed to be duly given.
output: According to Section 711(2)... Rule: Where the formalities required by the law of the country in which a donation or gift is given are completed, the donation/gift is deemed duly given. Application/Conclusion: Since the formalities were completed under the law of the country where the gift was given, the gift will be treated as duly given under this provision.

instruction: A foreigner damaged my property in Nepal. Which law decides liability for that tort?
input: Section no 712 . Determination of liability for tort : (1) While determining the liability for an act which, according to law constitutes a tort, involving a foreigner, foreign object or act done in a foreign country, it shall be determined according to the law of the country where such an act has been taken place.
output: According to Section 712(1)... Rule: Liability for a tort involving a foreigner, foreign object or an act done in a foreign country is determined by the law of the country where the act took place. Application/Conclusion: Because the damage occurred in Nepal (the act took place in Nepal), Nepali law will determine liability for that tort.

instruction: An online defamation started in Country A but the harmful effects hit Country B. Which country's law determines liability?
input: Section no 712  part (2) : If any act referred to in sub-section (1) originates in one country and results in consequence in another country, the liability shall 213 be determined according to the law of the country where the consequence so results.
output: According to Section 712(2)... Rule: If a tortious act originates in one country but results in consequences in another, liability is determined by the law of the country where the consequence occurs. Application/Conclusion: Because the harmful consequence occurred in Country B, liability should be determined according to Country B's law.

instruction: What if I can't tell where the consequences occurred or which country's law applies after a cross-border tort?
input: Section no 712  part (3) : If the liability cannot be determined pursuant to sub section (2), it shall be determined according to the law of the country where the tortious act has been committed.
output: According to Section 712(3)... Rule: If liability cannot be determined under subsection (2), then liability is determined by the law of the country where the tortious act was committed. Application/Conclusion: If you cannot establish the country of consequence under subsection (2), then apply the law of the country where the wrongful act itself occurred to determine liability.

instruction: I mistakenly received money from a foreign business in error. Which law decides unjust enrichment claims?
input: Section no 713 . Liability for quasi-contract or unjust enrichment : The liability for a quasi-contract or unjust enrichment shall be determined according to the law of the country where such an act has been done.
output: According to Section 713... Rule: Liability for quasi-contracts or unjust enrichment is governed by the law of the country where the relevant act was done. Application/Conclusion: To decide an unjust enrichment claim arising from that mistaken payment, apply the law of the country where the act (receipt/payment) occurred.

instruction: A situation involving a foreign company isn't covered in this Part. Which law should the court use?
input: Section no 714 . Other matters to be determined according to recognized : principles of private international law: (1) While determining any matter that is not dealt with in this Part involving a foreigner, foreign object or act done in a foreign country, such a matter shall be determined according to the law of Nepal, if Law of Nepal 405 provides separate provision in relation to that matter, and failing such separate provision, according to the recognized principles of private international law.
output: According to Section 714(1)... Rule: For matters not addressed in this Part that involve foreigners/foreign objects/acts abroad, apply Nepal law if it has a separate provision; if not, apply recognized principles of private international law. Application/Conclusion: The court should first check whether Nepal law (a specific Nepalese provision) governs the issue; if none exists, it will resolve the matter using accepted private international law principles.

instruction: Can parties to an international dispute agree to have Nepal law decide an issue not covered in this Part?
input: Section no 714  part (2) : Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), if all parties of the relevant matter so agree, the matter referred to in sub-section (1) shall be determined according to the law of Nepal.
output: According to Section 714(2)... Rule: Even if subsection (1) would point elsewhere, if all parties agree, the matter may be determined according to Nepal law. Application/Conclusion: Yes — if every party to the dispute expressly agrees, the issue not covered in this Part can be governed and decided under Nepal law.

instruction: I hold both Nepali and foreign nationality. Which nationality's law applies when nationality matters are relevant under this Part?
input: Section no 715 . In case of double nationality, law of country of habitual : residence to be applied: (1) If this Part contains a provision to the effect that any matter is determined according to the law of the country of nationality and a person is having nationality of two or more countries at the same time, his or her nationality shall be determined according to the law of the county of his or her nationality, where he or she habitually resides.
output: According to Section 715(1)... Rule: Where a rule in this Part refers to the law of a person's country of nationality but the person has multiple nationalities, the applicable nationality is that of the country where the person habitually resides. Application/Conclusion: Because you have dual nationality, determine which nationality applies by looking at the country of your habitual residence; the law of that country's nationality will be applied for matters under this Part.

instruction: Is a will executed abroad automatically effective in Nepal if it was valid where signed?

instruction: Where does the law say who decides claims about 'unjust enrichment' across borders?
